sentences.en: A range of official Disney merchandise was on sale.
sentences.cn: 一系列正版的迪士尼商品在出售。

sentences.en: After all, his merchandise was cheaper than other shops.
sentences.cn: 毕竟他的货物比别家便宜.

sentences.en: All very smartly turned out, they were like merchandise in a store.
sentences.cn: 她们都打扮得很好, 像铺子里的货物.

sentences.en: If the product is properly merchandised, it should sell very well.
sentences.cn: 这种产品如果营销得当，应该会大卖。

sentences.en: Merchandise can now circulate freely among the EU countries.
sentences.cn: 商品现在可以在欧盟各国自由流通。

sentences.en: Merchandise will be exchanged if found unsatisfactory.

sentences.cn: 零售商可以退回有缺陷的商品。

sentences.en: The merchandise is reasonably priced and offers exceptionally good value.
sentences.cn: 这些商品定价合理，很是划算。

sentences.en: The reputation of the firm was blown upon for passing substandard products off as first - class merchandise.
sentences.cn: 该公司因把次品当正品出售而名誉扫地.

sentences.en: They could sell their merchandise for quadruple the asking price.
sentences.cn: 他们能够以4倍于要价的价钱出售他们的商品。

sentences.en: They had shoplifted thousands of dollars' worth of merchandise.
sentences.cn: 他们已经偷了商店价值好几千美元的商品。
他们仔细地检查了商品。

sentences.en: Toothpaste is stock merchandise in a drugstore.
sentences.cn: 牙膏是杂货店里的常备商品.

sentences.en: We merchandise our furniture by advertising in newspapers.
sentences.cn: 我们在报上登广告推销家具.

sentences.en: We often call these goods merchandise.
sentences.cn: 我们通常把这些货叫做商品.

words.tran_cn: 商业的；商人的；重商主义的
适销的；可买卖的；有销路的

phrases.tran_cn: 商品存货；商品盘存；库存商品

trans.tran_en: to try to sell goods or services using methods such as advertising
